conclusion: To determine how the shadows A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the back left or right, we need to analyze the current positions of the shadows and how they are influenced by the light source's direction.

Shadows are formed by blocking the light. The direction of the shadow is opposite to the direction of the light source.
The length of the shadow depends on the angle of the light source relative to the object.
